backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor defining SurgeryCase data types (with Task checklist fields), user profiles, OpenAI config, and CRUD operations for cases with role-based access control using MixinAuthorization.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting five UI enhancements to CaseCard.tsx: colored borders for notes (green), presenting complaint (orange), Histo task (purple), Imaging task (blue), and species badge display.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Comprehensive summaries of all frontend TypeScript/React components covering authentication, case management, CSV import/export, task checklists, search/filter, and form validation with Task type usage.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light and dark themes defining colors for backgrounds, borders, charts, sidebar, and other UI elements using oklch color space.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for Surgery Case Log app with PWA manifest, favicons, theme color, and viewport meta tags configured for light mode.
frontend/public/manifest.json: PWA manifest defining app metadata (name, icons, theme colors, display mode) for Surgery Case Log as a standalone medical/productivity application.
frontend/public/sw.js: Service worker implementing cache-first strategy for static assets, precaching app shell, excluding Internet Identity and API calls from caching, with runtime cache management.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component managing authentication flow with Internet Identity, actor initialization, profile setup modal, view switching between cases and settings, admin-only settings access, and forced light theme enforcement.
frontend/src/features/auth/components/Lo: Login/logout button component that uses Internet Identity for authentication, handles login state transitions, and clears the query cache on logout.
frontend/src/features/auth/components/Pr: Modal dialog that prompts new users to enter their name during initial profile setup, preventing dismissal until completed.
frontend/src/features/cases/checklist.ts: Defines checklist items (discharge notes, labs, imaging, etc.) with their default states and provides utility functions to calculate task completion status and filter remaining items.
frontend/src/features/cases/components/C: Displays a surgery case card with patient details, remaining checklist tasks with checkboxes, editable notes, and delete/edit actions with confirmation dialog.

Dialog form for creating/editing surgery cases with fields for patient info, arrival date, checklist task selection, AI-powered structured text parsing, and MRN-based auto-prefill from existing cases.
Main view component that displays a filterable, searchable, sortable list of surgery case cards with CSV import/export and create/edit functionality.
Search input component with icon for filtering cases by any field text.
Dropdown select control for choosing case sort order from predefined options.
Popover filter with checkboxes for filtering cases by species (canine, feline, etc.), persisting selections to session storage.
A popover filter component that allows users to select task types to filter surgery cases by incomplete tasks, with state persisted to session storage.
A checklist editor component that displays task items as checkboxes, supporting both creation mode (selecting tasks) and completion mode (marking tasks complete).
A panel component providing CSV export and import functionality for surgery cases, with progress tracking, error handling, and support for creating or updating cases.
frontend/src/features/cases/components/D: A date input field component with calendar picker that accepts MM/DD/YYYY format, auto-formats input, validates dates, and supports auto-advancing to next field on completion.
Core CSV import/export logic that converts surgery cases to/from CSV format, parses CSV rows with validation, and matches imported cases to existing records by medical record number.
frontend/src/features/cases/csv/caseCsvS: Defines the CSV schema with 17 columns for surgery case import/export, including header names, data types, validation constants, and field mapping documentation.
frontend/src/features/cases/filtering.ts: Provides filtering functions to filter surgery cases by species and by incomplete task types based on checklist item selections.
frontend/src/features/cases/parsing/pars: Preprocesses raw OCR text by normalizing whitespace, correcting common character recognition errors (O/0, I/1/l confusion), removing artifacts, and cleaning punctuation. Used as a fallback for text cleaning when AI analysis returns semi-structured text.

Parses structured text in label:value format to extract case information fields (MRN, pet name, owner, dates, species, sex, breed, complaint) into a CaseFormData object. Serves as fallback for AI responses and supports Quick Fill feature.
frontend/src/features/cases/search.ts: Filters surgery cases by query string, searching across basic fields (MRN, names, species, breed, complaint, notes) and checklist task items that are selected but not completed.
frontend/src/features/cases/services/aiI: Empty file for AI image analysis service.
frontend/src/features/cases/sorting.ts: Provides sorting functionality for surgery cases by arrival date (newest/oldest) or open task count (most/fewest), with predefined sort options.
frontend/src/features/cases/types.ts: Defines TypeScript types and constants for case form data, including species options (canine, feline, other) and sex options (male, female, neutered/spayed variants).
frontend/src/features/cases/validation.t: Provides validation and parsing functions for case form fields including required field validation, species/sex parsing with fuzzy matching, boolean parsing, and date validation/parsing.
frontend/src/features/settings/component: React component for configuring OpenAI API key with validation status display, secure input field with show/hide toggle, and save functionality using React Query mutations.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React Query hook that creates and manages backend actor instances with Internet Identity authentication, initializes access control with admin token, and invalidates dependent queries on actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useDebouncedValue.ts: Custom React hook that debounces a changing value with configurable delay (default 500ms) using setTimeout cleanup pattern.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: React context and hook for Internet Identity authentication, managing login state, identity persistence, and delegation validation with configurable AuthClient options.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: React Query hooks for CRUD operations on surgery cases, including fetching all cases, fetching by MRN, creating, updating, and deleting cases with automatic cache invalidation.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables defining a light blue color scheme using OKLCH color space, including theme tokens for UI components and specific colors for patient names and presenting complaints.
frontend/src/lib/utils.ts: Utility function combining clsx and tailwind-merge for conditional CSS class name merging.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React Query, Internet Identity provider, and renders the root App component.
frontend/src/types/tesseract.d.ts: TypeScript type definitions for Tesseract.js OCR library, including worker interfaces, recognition options, result structures, and enums for page segmentation and OCR engine modes.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for extracting, persisting, and clearing URL parameters from both regular query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage integration for parameter persistence.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending the default theme with custom colors using OKLCH color space, container settings, animations, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project state tracking five implemented features that add colored borders around patient card fields (notes, Histo task, Imaging task, presenting complaint) and a species badge below the medical record number. Contains one pending aggregated requirement (AR-1) encompassing all these visual enhancements.
